fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64164].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in Cloud it's not possible to export more than 1k issues at the same time.
Due to this limitation, customers are exporting the issues in batches. However, doing so with "All fields" selected, will not always display the same columns, specially if one of the batches have an empty custom field for all exported issues, in which case the custom field won't appear.
The same happens for the option "With current columns".

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide static headers for the CSV Export. This way customers can always expected the CSV document to be the same.
fields.summary: CSV Export should always export with the same header order and fields
JIRA mail hander does not validate Host Name field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64161].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Even when the user has only one JIRA window open, after editing the issue, randomly receives a popup message advertising that himself or someone else was editing the issue and needs to refresh the page to see the latest data.
 !Screen Shot 2017-02-20 at 10.55.27 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open a JIRA Cloud window
# Create any Issue.
# Click on *edit* button
# Change something: could be the description and leave in edit mode for 30 seconds or more, for example.
# Save it
# Might need to repeat the steps 3, 4 and 5 twice.
The message box could be reproduced.

h3. Notes

* In some cases, this issue also occurs when simply viewing the issues.
fields.summary: Issue Updated: has been updated whilst you have been viewing it. Refresh the issue to view the latest data.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64160].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA stores the worklog, in the {{worklog}} table under the original name of the user. 
Example, if John's username was changed from john01 to john02. When he logs work, JIRA would log the work as john02. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Once the username has changed, then all existing worklogs have to be updated to the new name and all future worklogs must be done in the new username. 

h3. Why this is important
This could cause confusion to anyone analyzing the data directly from the DB and give them incorrect results.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like JIRA's worklog table to store worklog for a user with respect to the latest username of the user
Have full project sidebar for any board
Keyboard Input on contenteditable Element Triggers Shortcuts
Allow bulk association of project schemes
Enable Dashboard Access to Portal Only Customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64143].
  {panel}

h3. *Summary*

The JQL searches "watcher !=" and "watcher not in" are not working properly, they will return only issues where the watcher is not null, neither the referred user.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a new project (ex: TEST)
 # Create a new issue (ex: TEST-1)
 # Create two users, admin1 and admin2
 # Perform the JQL search: project = TEST and watcher != admin1, it will not return any issue.
 # Add admin2 as watcher in TEST-1.
 # Perform the JQL search: project = TEST and watcher != admin1, it will return the issue TEST-1.

h3. *Expected Results*

The JQL "watcher != user" should returns issues where the watcher is not equals of user.
h3. *Actual Results*

The JQL "watcher != user" only returns issues where the watcher is not equals of user and not null.
fields.summary: The JQL "watcher != user" and "watcher not in" are not working.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64142].
  {panel}

We received a request to add some steps that may facilitate the SSL implementation steps.
Customer was facing some issues to integrate JIRA with HIpChat over SSL.
Here is the steps taken:
{quote}
IMPORTANT: private key and keystore password need to be the SAME. If not then you need to specifiy the password for the private key *6)
1) Create CSR and private key on your linux box:
openssl req -newkey rsa:2048 -keyout private.key -out request.csr -subj "/C=na/ST=None/L=None/O=None/CN=None"
2) Create certificate with the generated CSR for your domain. (in StartSSL go to "Certificates Wizard", paste the generated CSR for your domain and submit. Download and extract the certificate and CA Chain.)
3) Create PFX file from certificate (step 2), private key (step 1) and Certificate Chain (step 2 - root bundle or intermediate cert depending on CA):
openssl pkcs12 -export -out <PFX-filename>.pfx -inkey private.key -in <your-certificate>.crt -certfile <CA-chain-file>.crt
(you can use the same password for the PFX file as for the private key to make things easier - we won't need the PFX file later and can destroy it)
The output should read like this:
>Enter pass phrase for private.key:
>Enter Export Password:
>Verifying - Enter Export Password:
4) Convert the PFX into a Java keystore. In your JRE bin directory on your linux box execute:
./keytool -importkeystore -srckeystore <PFX-filename>.pfx -destkeystore <new-keystore-file>.keystore -srcstoretype PKCS12 -deststoretype JKS
IMPORTANT: Use the SAME PASSWORD for the keystore as for the private key from step 1)! otherwise see *6)
The output should read like this:
>Enter destination keystore password:
>Re-enter new password:
>Enter source keystore password:
>Entry for alias 1 successfully imported.
>Import command completed:  1 entries successfully imported, 0 entries failed or cancelled
5)Edit your server.xml, uncomment the <Connector port="8443> and point the keystore entry to your <new-keystore>.keystore and supply the keystore password from step 1. (keystoreFile="<new-keystore>.keystore" keystorePass="<password from step 1>")
*6) If you want to set different passwords for the private key and the keystore then you have to:
./keytool -keypasswd -keystore /path/to/keyestore.file -alias <alias-in-keystore>
If you're not sure about the alias: ./keytool -list -keystore <name-of-keystore>
*7) Alternative to creating a PFX file including the CA chain file:
./keytool -importcert -alias startssl-CA-chain -keystore <path-to-atlassian-directory>/jre/lib/security/cacerts -file <CA Chain Cert in PEM format>.crt
{quote}
fields.summary: SSL documentation improve request
Allow search/replace in Bulk Edit
Accept certificates from Let's Encrypt for Web Hooks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64135].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, in the Welcome email that user gets once user creation is confusing for the user because it was sent by Atlassian. Some of our customers think that the welcome message of Atlassian is spam because they do not know Atlassian.

h3. Suggested Solution
 # Change the Atlassian word to JIRA, or
 # Add more information on the welcome page on the specific application, for example, JIRA, or
 # Give ability for the user to edit the Welcome email.

h3. Why this is important
Some customer thought the welcome message is a spam. So, it will be better if we can provide more information.
fields.summary: Ability to change Welcome Email content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64129].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

User has to cancel bug submit if dropdown does not have latest firmware and must ask admin to add.  Also, does not have options to add "Affects Version", "Fix Version", "Plan Closing Version", and "Component"
h3. Suggested Solution

 User can add firmware versions, but only Admin can delete them.  Also, added options above.
h3. Why this is important

Allows users to more quickly submit with more information.
fields.summary: More fields for Bug Submitter
Allow user to change assignee before saving comments.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64124].
  {panel}

Since JIRA is a source-available project, but not open-source, I don't think it makes sense to use bountysource.com or something similar.

In this day and age, every company has finite internal resources... why not make use of external resources as much as possible?  JIRA core developers I'm sure have their commercial and business-minded priorities, which may not exactly line up with customer-demand for specific features.

As a business, we need to keep moving.  We need to keep innovating and focus on our own core products.  We're not a JIRA company, we're a JIRA user, and we don't have the time to dig into JIRA source code and tackle making a significant change.

Let's offer development services to the community, at fair market value to address badly needed JIRA features, and JIRA Service Desk features, and any other projects that Atlassian Offers where customers can download the source code.

We would gladly pay $200, $500, $1000+, for a specific badly needed feature to be developed by the community that was vetted and incorporated into Atlassian mainline products and will be backed by their amazing support and development staff.  I'm sure this could be turned into a crowd funded development as well.  Or even a cloud based team development approach.  Maybe an entire new product line for Atlassian?  Imagine Atlassian CrowdFund... buy the platform and poof, now you have your own a crowd funding site.  But I digress.

Looking at the vote counts for many of these unaddressed open issues (mainly feature requests) in the tracker, with vote counts in the 100's or more or even 1000's or more, make me believe that it's definitely possible that 50 people watching an issue, who desperately need this new feature, would contribute $100 or more to see this issue completed, a $5000 or more community development bounty would surely attract some interest.
fields.summary: Create a bounty-based marketplace for Jira Bugs/Features

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64120].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
With the current REST API, it's possible to obtain various project related configurations such as
* properties
* roles
* issue security level scheme
* notification scheme
* permission scheme
* security level
* project type

However, it's not possible to obtain the following information
* workflow scheme
* screen scheme
* field configuration scheme

h3. Suggestion 
Create a REST resource to obtain these information
fields.summary: Obtain workflow, screens, and fields associated to a project via REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64114].
  {panel}

Reporting a bug against JIRA involves too many steps, including some unclear and some tedious, such that it’s almost not worth doing.

Expected results:
# You can create a bug report for JIRA in the same way you can create a bug report for SourceTree.

Actual:
# Attempt to create a bug against the JIRA project. Upon changing the type of report to “bug”, several fields disappear, including the Description field, and an infoblast appears with the text
{quote}Help us fix bugs faster 

To help us get the right details and fix bugs as quickly as possible, submit your bug report in our support system. 

You can still view, watch, comment on, and vote for existing bugs by searching for them in this project.{quote}
It has two buttons: “Report a new bug” and “Search for an existing bug”. Nobody has reported this issue yet, so click “Report a new bug”.
# Find yourself directed to Support System Hell. Find on page for “bug”—no results.
# Maybe creating an account will make the bug reporter appear? Create an account. No dice.
# Back on the Support System Hell Homepage, scan the items again:
#* JIRA Core documentation: not a place to report bugs, and also is JIRA Core different from just plain JIRA?
#* Knowledge base: not a place to report bugs
#* Community: not a place to report bugs, and probably part of the corporate Web disease that is the one-eyed answering the questions of the blind
#* Billing & licensing help: probably not helpful when it comes to reporting bugs
#* Product feedback: maybe…? No, wait, it just takes you back to the beginning of this mess.
#* Contact Technical Support: you don’t need additional people in the loop, especially ones who will, at worst, walk through the Uselessly Simplistic Official Support Flowchart to no avail, and at best, will report your issue without “helpfully” summarizing it and thereby losing potentially important information.
# The best possible outcome from the Support System Hell Homepage seems to be that the bug gets reported by tech support without modification, which means that you’ve gained nothing and wasted the time of a tech support employee.
# Grumble under your breath at the time lost creating a support account (which you’ll never use) and trying to navigate Support System Hell. Go back to the JIRA issue tracker, report the bug as a “suggestion”.
fields.summary: The JIRA bug reporting process has too many roadblocks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
 *Atlassian Update, June 21st, 2019:*
Hello,

This issue is fixed. The "component lead" field now shows updated username.

Thanks,
Jira cloud product management

{panel}
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64113].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When editing the Component, "Component lead" field is not showing updated username, which is causing confusion.
h3. Step to reproduce
 # Change the username of User A
 # Create a component and assign User A as the Component Lead
 # Edit Component
!EditComponentJIRA.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result

"Component lead" field is showing the updated username
h3. Actual Result

"Component lead" field is still showing the old username (user_key).
{noformat}
select * from app_user where user_key = 'admin';
id | user_key | lower_user_name 
-------+----------+-----------------
10000 | admin | ting
(1 row){noformat}
fields.summary: When Edit Component, "Component lead" is Showing Old Username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64112].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As in a feature request [IPv6 Support for JIRA|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36676], we don't support IPv6 on JIRA at this moment.
 In [some knowledgebase|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unable-to-connect-to-mail-server-due-to-ipv6-issues-on-jvm-637731067.html], there seems to be some mentions about it. However, there isn't in our official docs.
h3. Suggested Solution

We should announce it on our official docs like [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Supported+platforms], [JIRA requirements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/JIRA+applications+installation+requirements] as well.
fields.summary: Documentation about IPv6
Allow child commits to roll up to parents
Improve full JIRA Import capabilities to prevent the deletion of existing data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64108].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It's not possible to display the Parent Field on a Sub-task Screen in JIRA so that it has the Icon, Key and Summary like in Portfolio,(instead of just in the Breadcrumb Trail) so it makes easier the visibility of the parent issues when looking at the sub-tasks.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the Parent field on the sub-task screen, so that shows the Icon of the Parent issue type, the key, and the Summary.
h3. Why this is important

Helps on the visibility of the Parent issues when viewing the sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Display Parent Field on a Sub-task Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64107].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The [JIRA 6.4 documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/configuring-jira-with-hipchat-720412710.html] has a section about the issue preview feature of the HipChat integration. None of the [JIRA 7.x pages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/integrating-with-collaboration-tools-828787612.html] does. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a section about issue previews. This should be done the same way it's done for JIRA 6.4. 
h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Document the issue preview feature of the HipChat integration for JIRA 7.x

fields.description:

h3. Problem Definition

 !2017-02-15_menu-items.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64103].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently date fields in system information do not appear to follow a consistent format, even for values generated by the same add-on. The is especially true in the case of the analytics add-on:
|com.atlassian.analytics.client.configuration..analytics_disabled_date|2017-01-31 18:55:35|
|com.atlassian.analytics.client.upload.last_date|1/31/17 11:03 AM|
h3. Suggested Solution

Where possible, dates should follow ISO 8601 or another standardized, documented format.
fields.summary: Make date/time formats in system information consistent
As a user I want to have documentation for object type returned by CustomField.getValue()
Notification helper should list custom notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64098].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
There's currently no REST API resource to trigger a re-index in a project and also monitor the indexing progress.

h3. Suggestion
Create a new REST resource to trigger a re-index in a project and also monitor the indexing progress. If possible, it should be able to trigger re-index in multiple projects as well.
fields.summary: REST API to re-index project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64097].
  {panel}

The system should be designed with much heavier use of cache on all levels.

Some examples of poor design in Jira that your dev team should attend to:
 * Trying to edit a comment, there's no reason for an Ajax request to load the dialog. The text is in the page and so are the edit tools. Only ajax request should be on updating it.
 * Trying to change assignee on an issue would load the users list via Ajax request. Why not cache this in localstorage?

There are many more occasions where needless requests are made and the system thus responds much slower than needed. Perhaps it becomes more evident on the cloud _service_ which is obviously overloaded. I could now see that refresh a simple issue page would take 1.1-2.5 seconds to fetch the HTML part of the page (without resources). This should have constantly been under 1sec and the changes clarify the server is overloaded.
fields.summary: Improve Cloud platform performance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64096].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, *Select List (cascading)* value is refer as one value when exporting to Excel/CSV. 

h3. Suggested Solution

When exporting to Excel/CSV file, the two value inserted to *Select List (cascading)* field will split to two different column.

h3. Why this is important
 Easier for user/customer to track the value in Excel.
fields.summary: Split "Select List (cascading)" value to different column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64095].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Sometimes, the sidebar does not load properly while browsing an issue. No icon appears on the sidebar and message "Unable to render element due to an error" appears on the top of the sidebar. Users have to refresh few times to get the sidebar loaded properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
N/A as this happens intermittently for some customers

h3. Expected Results
The issue details and sidebar are displayed without any error

h3. Actual Results
Occasionally the sidebar shows "Unable to render element due to an error" while the below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
2017-02-14 15:57:28,689 http-nio-8080-exec-202 ERROR anonymous 6x15350x1 oclbhd 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /browse/DESK-4095 [c.a.p.webresource.assembler.DefaultWebResourceAssembler] Error generating bigpipe content for 'sidebar-id': Deadline exceeded
java.lang.RuntimeException: Deadline exceeded
	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.bigpipe.QueueFutureCompletionService.forceCompleteAll(QueueFutureCompletionService.java:62)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.bigpipe.BigPipe.forceCompleteAll(BigPipe.java:33)
...
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
# Navigate to {{http:<JIRA-base-URL>/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!Default.jspa}} to get to the Dark Features page.
# Enable the dark feature *com.atlassian.jira.config.BIG_PIPE_KILLSWITCH*.
fields.summary: Sidebar occasionally shows "Unable to render element due to an error" error while viewing issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64094].
  {panel}

Hi,

Please consider adding configuration for allowing zero and negative worklog entries. Use cases:
 * As we are transferring hours to other tool automatically we would like to see mistake entries as zero values.
 * We are comparing worklog entries with summup pluging to budget. If negative entries could be entered we would see on dashboard how many hours are left on the budget bu calculating spent time + negative budget. The result would be negative which does not matter as the value would be correct.

Thanks and Regards,

Jussi
fields.summary: Configuration for negative and zero work log entries

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64093].
  {panel}

We'd like to authorize a group of users to have permission to only create new projects, but NOT to be able to alter or add workflows, custom fields, screens, etc.

Currently, when you authorize a user to be able to create new projects, he/she is also able to change the aforementioned 'object types' in JIRA, which are standardized and should not be altered or added to.

To my knowledge, JIRA does not allow to differentiate between these kind of authorisations.

Adding additional Global Permissions or adding more levels of user permissions would help keep the system manageable for those responsible for maintaining it at company/organisation level.
fields.summary: Adding options to Global Permissions or adding levels of authorisation
Unable to automatically add Confluence to your site
Custom Quick Filters for JIRA Core Business

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64090].
  {panel}

*Summary:*  Worklog data is not stored according to the user profile time zone but specific to the server timezone (UTC). 

*Problem Definition:*
This can create confusing results when users from different time zones are entering time. It is hard to gauge without some manual conversion what time they actually. In some cases it can throw the figure off by day i.e. 10/31/2017 5 PM PST Converts to 11/01/2017 2:00 AM CET.

*Suggested Solution:*
Have an additional field where worklog entries are stored according to the user profile timezone. See comments by Mark on [JRA-35503|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35503?focusedCommentId=532102&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-532102]. 

*Why this is important:* 
Right now there is unnecessary friction and leg work for the users end to correct this problem.
fields.summary: Store worklog data according to user profile timezone in a different field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64089].
  {panel}

*Summary:* Our documentation does not clear state in either the [User Profile| or [Logging work|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/logging-work-on-an-issue-720416377.html] or [User Profile Timezone|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER072/Managing+your+user+profile]  that the worklog data is not stored according to the user profile time zone but specific to the server timezone (UTC). 

*Problem Definition:*
This can create confusing results when users from different time zones are entering time. It is hard to gauge without some manual conversion what time they actually. In some cases it can throw the figure off by day i.e. 10/31/2017 5 PM PST Converts to 11/01/2017 2:00 AM CET.

*Suggested Solution:*
Update documentation to reflect how work log data is actually stored. 

*Why this is important:* 
This creates a lot of confusion when tracking time within JIRA. JIRA treats it as the long entry as an absolute point that is stored in UTC as reflected by the developers comment on [JRA-35503|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35503?focusedCommentId=532112&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-532112]
fields.summary: Update documentation that work log entries are stored in UTC Server System Time.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is a possibility to move Sprints *up* and *down*, but this only moves the Sprint for one position. 

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would want to have possibility to drag and drop the Sprints, which would allow faster rearranging of the Sprints
 
h3. Workaround 
-
fields.summary: Add possibility to move Sprints in Backlog trough drag and drop functionality
Support background color in the Wiki Markup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64074].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Unlicensed users are not able to receive notifications for JIRA Software and JIRA Core. As other customers report, this used to work in the past. But while taking multiple tests into Cloud Instances (this was only tested with Cloud).

To test that you can:
 # Create a user without any application access
 # Create a notification scheme that includes this user (we tested by allowing browse projects permission and notification through a user custom field and also through watchers field)
 # Add user to that issue as a watcher or using a custom field
 # Make sure the user has browse permission access to that issue
 # Try to generate notification
 # No Notification is sent, neither information is thrown on outgoing mail log

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow this type of user to receive notifications.
h3. Why this is important

There are use cases when users need to receive only mail notifications and will not need to use JIRA internal functionalities, this is demanding this kind of users to consume a license only to receive e-mails.
h3. Workaround

Send the notification to a single email address, without creating the user with no application access. 
This should work since -JRA-63395- has been fixed. (Only works if the project is set as public - anyone can access)
fields.summary: Unlicensed users do not receive issue notifications
User wants to log in

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64063].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The problem was reported on Firefox 50.1.0. I was also able to reproduce it on Firefox 51.0.1. The header menu on the application header doesn't come down if resolution.
h3. Environment

Cloud - JIRA v1000.747.1
Firefox - 50.1.0 / 51.0.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On the view issue screen, click *Boards or any header menu*

h3. Expected Results

The dropdown works as it does if not under the described configuration.
h3. Actual Results

The menu doesn't work.

h3. Notes
Checking console panel, the requests are sent with status 200.
fields.summary: Header menu do not work on view issue page on Firefox 50.1 or above
Adding pinned comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64060].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary

When a user creates a new issue and adds a table in the description field, the table when viewed would appear skewed on Chrome browser.

h5. Steps To Reproduce

|Affected JIRA Version| 7.3.0|
|Browser|Chrome only|

Version had no

# Create a new issue.
# In the description field, add the following:
{panel}
|*Data*|*Create Type*|*Update Type*|*Constraints*|
|*Airspace*| | | |
|validity period|M|U|see general use case|
|cfmuId|D|D|We receive feedback from a number of different sources and evaluate those when we plan our product roadmap. If you would like to know more about how the JIRA Product Management team uses your input in our planning process, please see our post on Atlassian Answers.|
{panel}
# View the Issue once it has been created.

h5. Expected Result

Issue appears aligned properly.

h5. Actual Result

The issue's columns would appear skewed to the left with text overflowing to new lines.

(!) If the user is being viewed by a user with read-only permission, it appears correctly.
* For this log out of JIRA and view the issue.
fields.summary: Table Alignment Broken in Description Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64057].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if user configures Outgoing Mail, edited the configuration and clicked "Test" and leave the screen, the password is not stored

h3. Suggested Solution

1) Add more button "Test and Save". If credentials are correct - save it
2) Add "Clear this field after test" - this will not make users think that password is saved when they press button "Save"

h3. Workaround 

Click "Update" button to save the changes after editing the Outgoing Mail configuration.

h3. Problem Definition

The Comment panel seems to be restricted to *only* being vertically modified, by being longer or shorter. Users would like the freedom to re-size the panel as they wish including, making it wider. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Remove the restrictions on the comment panel and grant the user the freedom to resize it as they wish.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64054].

h3. Problem Definition
The default priorities' icons which are:
* /images/icons/priorities/highest.svg
* /images/icons/priorities/high.svg
* /images/icons/priorities/medium.svg
* /images/icons/priorities/low.svg
* /images/icons/priorities/lowest.svg

All these icons are not available in the _Select image_ for new Priority:

The workaround is to use the relative path to the JIRA web application to use the icons for new Priority but this will be affected by [JRA-42952|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42952] where it will be added as an attachment.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the icons available in the _Select image_ for new Priority:
fields.summary: Default priorities' icons are not available for new Priority

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64043].
  {panel}

There doesn't seem to be any means to set the calendar start day to either Friday or Saturday.

This is really affecting our remote teams as local calendars, and cultural default is that the calendar week starts on a Saturday, (Some countries default calendar starts on Friday too).

But, for the most part, this precludes people from viewing calendars in a "normal" format for the following countries:

BD, MV, AE, AF, BH, DJ, DZ, EG, IQ, IR, JO, KW, LY, MA, OM, QA, SD, SY...

Bangladesh, Maldives, UAE, Afghanistan, Bahrain, Djibouti, Algeria, Egypt, Iraq, Iran, Jordan, Kuwait, Lybia, Oman, Morocco, Sudan, Syria, ...
fields.summary: Cannot Set Start of Week to Friday or Saturday
Browse Project permission needs further limitation options
Documentation Enhancement - "Update User attributes on Login" for Delegated LDAP Directories
Update Database Schema Developer Docs for JIRA 7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64038].
  {panel}

Every time I install a new plugin (happen a lot at our shop)  I have to go in and set the various services to either WARN or ERROR as I will set it to INFO or DEBUG when I am diagnosing a problem only.  

It would be great to have a pull down that say "set all services to", so I could set everything to WARN at once, and then I could go and and tweak on an individual basis all the ones I wanted something else.

Or I could go in and edit log4j.properties, and then if there was a default that every time a new value was put into the file it would read the default and use it.

Just my two cents...
fields.summary: Have a set all or default setting for Logging and Profiling

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64036].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Starting from JIRA 7.3 project administrator are allowed to edit workflow as long as the project workflow fulfill below criteria:
# The workflow isn't shared with any other projects (it's only available in your project),
# The workflow isn't the default JIRA workflow (no-one can edit these workflows).

However Project administrator cannot configure any resolutions or force users to provide a resolution in a workflow. As mentioned in [Workflows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver073/workflows-861256323.html], project administrator:
# Create, add, edit or delete transitions (you can't edit a transition's properties, conditions, validators or post-functions).

Due the fact that post function and condition are not allowed to be edited by project admin it makes impossible for project admin to define resolution for an editted workflow.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Project admins to *edit a transition's properties, conditions, validators or post-functions* so that project adminstrator can add resolution or force user to select resolution when an user is closing an issue
fields.summary: Ability to Configure Resolution In Workflow by Project Administrator

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64029].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
After you initially click Menu Items in JIRA. They do not auto collapse and require a left click off the menu bar to collapse the menu. I've attached a demo video of the issue to this ticket. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a user profile option to set this setting on auto collapse or a time interval before auto collapsing. 
h3. Why this is important
 It can create unnecessary actions to reduce screen clutter by having click off the menu bar to collapse the menu.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64028].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When exporting an issue using the printable export, it does not export the issue activity and only comments are exported along with the issue details.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow JIRA to export the issue activity on the printable export.


h3. Workaround 

h6. Option 1:
* You can use a browser plugin to take a *scrolling screenshot* : 
** Such as [[https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/full-page-screen-capture/fdpohaocaechififmbbbbbknoalclacl/related?hl=en]]. 

h6. Option 2: 
* Use the browser print feature to print the entire screen. Make sure to add _?filter=-1_ at the end of the issue URL in order to be able to print all the activity in case it has multiple pages (e.g http://cloud_site_name.atlassian.net/browse/TEST-1?filter=-1)
** Note: This workaround may be not be functional for most of the sites after the upgrade to the new Jira experience:
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to export the issue activity on the printable export.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64027].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
We currently only support the quartz syntax [Quartz Scheduled Cron jobs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/scheduled-jobs-96567525.html#ScheduledJobs-Cronexpressions] which doesn't allow for calculations such as every other week on a specific day. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement syntax that allows for calculations as indicated above. 
h3. Why this is important
 It gives the customer the granularity to schedule services in specific time windows of low usage or time frames that are reserved for maintenance windows.
fields.summary: Allow cron schedule to be specified in every other week intervals.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64026].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When performing an upgrade with the installer the backups are archived in a zip format, which does not preserve file permissions in Linux/Unix (just in Windows). This can cause problems during the restore.

h3. Suggested Solution
Use a file format for the backup like tar or tar.gz for the backup that would preserve and store the file permission in the archive.

h3. Workaround
Manually apply permissions to the {{<confluence-home>}} and {{<confluence-install>}} directories for the user account that runs the application.
fields.summary: Linux/Unix installer backup should create backup file with an archive that preserves the file permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64023].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, issues in the Burndown Chart Report are ordered in alphabetical order. 
*  !Burndown chart issues.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Show the issues in numerical instead of alphabetical order 
 
h3. Workaround 
-
fields.summary: Show issues in numerical instead of alphabetical order in Burndown Chart Report - Standardize this in all reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64021].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When Site Admin login as another user in JIRA, the only security measure available at the moment is to send an email notification to the actual user that the admin is logging in with his account. However, there is no log that keep track of who login as the user, at what time, and what did he do with it.

This may cause some loophole in the security, in which the site admin would be able to log in as other user and make crucial changes without the person in contact knowing.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to record when a Site Admin login as another user, the duration of the session, and what actions that the Site Admin do as the user.
fields.summary: Record in a log when a Site Admin login as another user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64019].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently users in JIRA can log unlimited hours of work in an issue. Some admins would like to restrict amount of hours that users can enter per specific entry.


h3. Suggested Solution

Provide option in Time Tracking on maximum hours users can log per entry.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Limit Log Work hours

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64018].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
In JIRA 6.x, when a user click on the value of fix version field, it will direct to version summary page. At the moment, in JIRA 7.x, clicking on the value of fix version field will direct user to issue navigator retrieving issues associated with the selected version.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to switch back to the previous implementation where it directs to version page instead of issue navigator.
fields.summary: Having the option to get redirected to version summary page when clicking on version value

JIRA Calendar Gadget should also show tickets at the grayed out days

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64008].
  {panel}

h3. *Problem Definition*
When cloning an issue in JIRA, an existing issues is copied into a new issues and a ‘clone’ link is created between the original issue and the newly created (clone) issue. 

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Add the possibility to create another link relationship (e.g. ‘implement’ link) between the original issue and the newly created issue, either instead of the ‘clone’ link or in addition to the ‘clone’ link.

h3. *Why this request*
Cloning of issues is typically done to create a hierarchy of issues (parent-child relationship). For example, implementing a Business Epic ‘A’ requires the implementation of features ‘X’, ‘Y’ and ‘Z’. Implementation of feature ‘X’ requires work in JIRA project ‘P1’, ‘P2’ and ‘P3’, for feature ‘Y’ it requires work in project ‘P2’, ‘P4’, etcetera. So ‘A’ must be cloned to ‘X’, ‘Y’ and ‘Z’ and from there issues need to be cloned to ‘P1’, ‘P2’, etc. All hierarchy relationships require an ‘implement’ link between the parent and the child.
“Clone & move” is used to create the issues, but for each newly created issues the “Link” function must be used to create the parent-child relationship with the ‘implement’ link.
Since it typically involves a large number of new issues, it is a lot of work switching between “Clone & Move” and the “Link” function, and it is easy to make a mistake (e.g. linking the wrong issue ids, or omitting the ‘implement’ link). By including the linking in the clone function, JIRA knows exactly which issues are concerned (i.e. the original and the clone) reducing the amount of work and reducing the amount of mistakes, and the user is more likely (to not forget) to create the link.


h3. *Why this is important*
# The hierarchical structure has an immediate impact on the development planning, and therefore mistakes have too (e.g. missing ‘implement’ links). Similarly the mistakes have impact on the progress control of business epics.
# The hierarchical structure will be used for aggregating time writing (from JIRA to Clarity) and time writing is used to account financial of projects (Clarity). Mistakes in the hierarchy will have impact on the financial accounting to projects.
fields.summary: Improve Existing Clone Link Feature in JIRA
Add a "checkbox" feature to the Description Editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64004].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The JIRA Cloud Document: [Import and export data |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/import-and-export-data-744721621.html]
 for step 1 refers to JIRA applications [Importing issues |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-issues-776636788.html] This document details at Point 2 step 1:
{quote}2. Import the data
 1. Upload the files to the cloud by [using WebDAV |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/upload-data-via-webdav-744721622.html]. (For backup files larger than 4GB, refer to [Uploading Large files to WebDAV |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/uploading-large-files-to-webdav-747834468.html])
{quote}
The first link: [using WebDAV |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/upload-data-via-webdav-744721622.html] is a reciprocal link back to document 1 with no additional information

The Second Link [Uploading Large files to WebDAV |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/uploading-large-files-to-webdav-747834468.html] Notes the Deprication of the webdav with:
{quote}(!) Atlassian Cloud applications no longer support WebDAV. For updated import information, please refer to [Import and export data |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/import-and-export-data-744721621.html].
{quote}
The link provided [Import and export data |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/import-and-export-data-744721621.html] is also a link back to the first document with no additional information on the new process for uploading data for a Import.
h3. Suggested Solution

The new process needs to be detailed in the import documentation directly.

Since of the Depreciation of the WebDav the new process has been added in the Cloud instance directly on the *Second Step* of the *JIRA Import Wizard* So the only way to notified of the new process is to initiate the process before reading the documentation pages as you must start the import to reveal these details:
{quote}
h2.Before you begin
# Back up your JIRA Cloud site data using Backup Manager
 # Prepare an export of your other JIRA Cloud or Server instance.
 # If you want to include attachments, avatars, or logos in this import, create compressed copies of the following:
 * <JIRA_HOME>/data/attachments directory (with attachments as the top-level directory, or project keys within attachments as the top-level directory).
 * <JIRA_HOME>/data/avatars directory (with avatars as the top-level directory)
 * <JIRA_HOME>/logos directory (with logos as the top-level directory)
{quote}
!Screen Shot 2017-02-06 at 4.41.01 PM.png|thumbnail!

Between step 2 and 3 the JIRA Import File only file is uploaded from local file system to the webdav, and there is still no indication of were in the process attachments, avatars, or logos files are to be uploaded. Step 3 Notes:
{quote}
Before the import is started, the JIRA export and optional archives must be uploaded to your Atlassian Cloud instance using WebDAV. For instructions on connecting to your WebDAV directory, [see this documentation | http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Uploading+Data+via+WebDAV]. The import data must be at the root-level of your WebDAV directory and not within a sub-folder.
{quote}
*Also Redirecting to the first document:* [Import and export data | https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/import-and-export-data-744721621.html] with no indication of how or when to do this.
!Screen Shot 2017-02-06 at 4.48.33 PM.png|thumbnail!

Next step Initiates the Restore

Once Restore is successful to upload the Attachments/Avatars/logos  you have to Do the process again but this time upload the zip of the attachments rather than the jira backup,  once complete repeat for each subsequent ZIP file so in total you will need to repeat the full migration process four time to transfer all data once for each:
- jira-backup.zip
- attachments.zip
- avatars.zip
- logos.zip
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud Import Documentation Update required Missing critical info

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64003].
  {panel}

As a team who uses and monitors the Cumulative Flow Diagram (CFD) extensively,

We would like for the CFD report tool to include a toggle that starts the diagram from zero

So that it's easier to analyze the flow when there are many completed items.

*Background*

When there are many issues listed in the bottom most band in the graph, the CFD becomes unreadible as all other bands become very narrow and the vertical movement of the bands may not be very apparent.  Eliminating all issues that move into the bottom most status in the CFD prior to the start of the CFD will effectively reduce the graphed issues and make the graph more useful.

Currently our team is able to get this behavior by using a quickfilter but it is cumbersome as you must adjust the quickfilter whenever the report date range is changed.

This is what the CFD looks like today:
 !cfd_before.png|thumbnail!

This is what it would look like with this feature implemented and enabled:
 !cfd_after.png|thumbnail!  
 
----
*Acceptance Criteria*
 * Include a checkbox in the CFD tool labeled "Exclude already resolved issues"
 ** When the checkbox is checked, limit the issue set being reported with the following additional JQL:
 *** AND ((status != <Right most status that's toggled>) or (status=<Right most status that's toggled> and status changed after <start date of the graph's range>))
 *** e.g. if the final status tracked is "Done" and we start the graph in Jan 1, 2016 the JQL would be: AND ((status = Done and status changed after 01-01-2016) or status != Done)
 ** When the checkbox is not checked, the CFD should behave as it does today
fields.summary: Allow CFD to start from zero with a toggle

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64001].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

If an issues has lots of work log entries, they are currently all loaded in the work log tab.  This causes long load times for some issues and a unnecessarily long page.

h3. Suggested Solution

Limit the initial result set to the most recent work log entries, similar to how comments and activity stream have limited initial results, with links to give the full list.
fields.summary: Limit results in work log tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63999].
  {panel}

Hello, Team.

 

The user wants to have the ability to customize the default status colors in workflows in JIRA.

 

He doesn't want to use the defaults green, yellow and blue.

 

Thank you!
fields.summary: User wants to customize workflow status colors
